subject: Investing
title: Automating Decisions to Beat Bias
description: A micro-lesson that makes Automating Decisions to Beat Bias usable.

hook.text: A study showed investors who automated contributions earned 2% more annually than those who invested manually.

buildup.text: Automating recurring investments removes the moment of hesitation where bias strikes.

discovery.text: Automatic rebalancing, dividend reinvestment, and payroll deductions enforce discipline by design.

twist.text: The best part: automation works hardest during scary markets, buying shares when you'd otherwise freeze.

climax.text: Set it up once, review it annually, and let the system do what your emotions won't.

punchline.text: The best investor is a robot with your goals and none of your feelings.

quiz.question: Why does automating investments improve returns?
